bibl.title: Charles Smith v. John Coldwell. Order Granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory holding Terms at Seattle King Co. Wash. Ty.
In the matter of the application of Chas Smith } No.5954 for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

On reading and filing the petition of Charles Smith duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that he is illegaly imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by one John Coldwell at the City of Seattle King Co. Wash. Terr. and stating wherein the illegality consists, from which it appears that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue.

It is ordered that a Writ of Habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of the Dist. Court of the 3rd Judicial Dist of Wash. Tery. aforesaid directed to the said John Coldwell commanding him to have the body of the said Charles Smith before me in the Court room of the said court on the 11th day of May 1888 at 10 o'clock A.M. of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Charles Smith, together with the time and cause of his detention
and that he then and there have the said Writ
Dated this 10th day of May A.D. 1888
No. 5954 In Dist. Ct at Seattle
In re Charles Smith for Writ of Habeas Corpus
